argumentText:
ARGUMENT
x y

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_elreal | |- ( A e. RR <-> E. x e. R. <. x , 0R >. = A ) |
| 2 |  | #P_elreal | |- ( B e. RR <-> E. y e. R. <. y , 0R >. = B ) |
| 3 |  | #P_oveq1 | |- ( <. x , 0R >. = A -> ( <. x , 0R >. + <. y , 0R >. ) = ( A + <. y , 0R >. ) ) |
| 4 | 3 | #P_eleq1d | |- ( <. x , 0R >. = A -> ( ( <. x , 0R >. + <. y , 0R >. ) e. RR <-> ( A + <. y , 0R >. ) e. RR ) ) |
| 5 |  | #P_oveq2 | |- ( <. y , 0R >. = B -> ( A + <. y , 0R >. ) = ( A + B ) ) |
| 6 | 5 | #P_eleq1d | |- ( <. y , 0R >. = B -> ( ( A + <. y , 0R >. ) e. RR <-> ( A + B ) e. RR ) ) |
| 7 |  | #P_addresr | |- ( ( x e. R. /\ y e. R. ) -> ( <. x , 0R >. + <. y , 0R >. ) = <. ( x +R y ) , 0R >. ) |
| 8 |  | #P_addclsr | |- ( ( x e. R. /\ y e. R. ) -> ( x +R y ) e. R. ) |
| 9 |  | #P_opelreal | |- ( <. ( x +R y ) , 0R >. e. RR <-> ( x +R y ) e. R. ) |
| 10 | 8, 9 | #P_sylibr | |- ( ( x e. R. /\ y e. R. ) -> <. ( x +R y ) , 0R >. e. RR ) |
| 11 | 7, 10 | #P_eqeltrd | |- ( ( x e. R. /\ y e. R. ) -> ( <. x , 0R >. + <. y , 0R >. ) e. RR ) |
| 12 | 1, 2, 4, 6, 11 | #P_2gencl | |- ( ( A e. RR /\ B e. RR ) -> ( A + B ) e. RR ) |
\
 Closure law for addition in the real subfield of complex numbers.  Axiom 5 of 22 for real and complex numbers, derived from ZF set theory.  This construction-dependent theorem should not be referenced directly, nor should the proven axiom ~ ax-addrcl be used later.  Instead, in most cases use ~ readdcl .  (Contributed by NM, 31-Mar-1996.) (New usage is discouraged.)
